front.title: An Overview of Operations, Administration, and Maintenance (OAM) Mechanisms

abstract.t: Operations, Administration, and Maintenance (OAM) is a general term that refers to a toolset that can be used for fault detection and isolation, and for performance measurement. OAM mechanisms have been defined for various layers in the protocol stack, and are used with a variety of protocols. This document presents an overview of the OAM mechanisms that have been defined and are currently being defined by the IETF.
